subject: Learning
title: Critical Periods in Brain Development
description: One-minute skill: Critical Periods in Brain Development.

hook.text: A kitten with one eye patched for the first weeks of life never develops vision in that eye. The window closed.

buildup.text: Critical periods are time windows when the brain is especially receptive to specific types of input.

discovery.text: Vision, language, and social bonding all have critical periods. Missing input during the window impairs development.

twist.text: Most critical periods are 'sensitive periods'â€”learning is easier but not impossible outside the window.

climax.text: Understanding these windows helps parents and educators prioritize the right experiences at the right times.

punchline.text: The brain has seasons. Some lessons are best planted when the soil is ready.

quiz.question: What happens if critical-period input is missing?
options: Development in that area is impaired, sometimes permanently
The brain compensates perfectly with other senses
Critical periods have no real effect on development
